descript.abstract: Job Concentrations displays employment density of jobs located within the MfgCenters as identified in the Jobs and Activity Centers defined by the Metropolitan Council of the 7-county Twin Cities Metropolitan area of Minneapolis and St. Paul, Minnesota (see DataFinder.org). Job locations and Job and Activity Centers are based on the Minnesota Dept. of Employment and Economic Development's (DEED) Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW).
descript.purpose: Job Concentrations help identify locations of concentrated jobs that benefit from existing regional and local infrastructure investment (i.e., wastewater, highways, and transit) and where the continued orderly and economic development of the region and effective stewardship of our regional investments should be encouraged.
descript.supplinf: Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.

timeperd.current: Job Concentrations is based on location of 2010 jobs within Job and Activity Centers which are contiguous areas of 7,000 or more jobs where the net employment density is at least 10 jobs per acre.

theme.themekey: Jobs, Employment, job and activity centers, employment center, QCEW

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County

browse.browsed: Sample map showing the Job Concentrations layer.

citeinfo.title: MN DEED Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages, 2010

dataqual.complete: Entire seven county geographic area is covered. Incompleteness in attribute information is discussed under 'Attribute Accuracy' above.

procstep.procdesc:
DATA SOURCES: - Minnesota Dept. of Employment and Economic Development's (MNDEED) 2012Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW) - Job and Activity Centers
PROCESSING STEPS FOR THE JOB CONCENTRATIONS LAYER: Minnesota Dept. of Employment and Economic Development's (MNDEED) 2012 Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW) is point-based, geocoded-worksite employment data. Employment data located within the largest Job and Activity Centers (contiguous areas of 7,000 or more jobs where the net employment density is at least 10 jobs per acre) were identifed. Using Spatial Analysis, the Kernal Density tool was used to create a density surface of those qualifying jobs.

overview.eaover:
Attributes:
VALUE: Grid classifiaction number
JobsPerAcre: Generalized Jobs per acre

If you transmit or provide the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user, it is recommended that the GIS Data include a copy of this disclaimer and this metadata.
